user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_add_page_size:
```c
static int metal_add_page_size(const char *path, int shift, int mmap_flags)
{
	int index = _metal.num_page_sizes;
	unsigned long size = 1UL << shift;

	if (index >= MAX_PAGE_SIZES) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_WARNING, "skipped page size %ld - overflow\n",
			  size);
		return -EOVERFLOW;
	}

	if (!path || shift <= 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_WARNING, "skipped page size %ld - invalid args\n",
			  size);
		return -EINVAL;
	}

	_metal.page_sizes[index].page_shift = shift;
	_metal.page_sizes[index].page_size = size;
	_metal.page_sizes[index].mmap_flags = mmap_flags;
	strncpy(_metal.page_sizes[index].path, path, PATH_MAX);
	_metal.num_page_sizes++;

	metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "added page size %ld @%s\n", size, path);

	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_add_page_size:
#define MAX_PAGE_SIZES 32
...
#define metal_log(level, fmt, __VA_ARGS__) ({if(_metal.common.log_handler&&level<=_metal.common.log_level)_metal.common.log_handler(level,metal_fmt(fmt),##__VA_ARGS__);\
})
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No occurrences of memcmp (or any other standard-library comparison used on null-terminated strings) are present in the provided function or the related macro snippet. The only string operation in metal_add_page_size is strncpy(), which copies rather than compares, so it is not relevant to MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14. The metal_log macro and its expansion shown do not call memcmp either. Therefore there are no code fragments in the given code that need investigation for Rule 21.14. (If memcmp is used elsewhere in the project, those translation units would need to be checked, but they are outside the provided code.)
